org.deidentifier.arx.masking

Class GenerateRandomStringMasker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractDictionaryMasker<T>
      • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<java.lang.String>
        • org.deidentifier.arx.masking.GenerateRandomStringMasker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDictionaryMasker<java.lang.String>, IInstanceMasker<java.lang.String>

    public class GenerateRandomStringMasker
extends AbstractInstBasedDictMasker<java.lang.String>
    A masker that generates random strings according to a set of user-specified rules.

    The user can specify the length of the generated strings or whether to use the length of the input strings, he can choose to generate alphabetic, numeric or alphanumeric strings or he can specify a set of characters from which the strings are constructed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GenerateRandomStringMasker()
      Creates a masker generating strings with the same length as the input, using only alphabetic characters.
      GenerateRandomStringMasker(boolean letters, boolean numbers)
      Creates a masker generating strings with the same length as the input data, using alphabetic and numeric characters, depending on the parameters.
      GenerateRandomStringMasker(char[] charSet)
      Creates a masker generating strings with the same length as the input, using random characters from the supplied character set.
      GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length)
      Creates a masker generating alphabetic strings with the specified length.
      GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length, boolean letters, boolean numbers)
      Creates a masker generating strings with the specified length, using alphabetic and numeric characters, depending on the parameters.
      GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length, boolean letters, boolean numbers, char[] charSet)
      Creates a masker generating strings with the specified length, using random characters from the supplied character set.
      GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length, char[] charSet)
      Creates a masker generating strings with the specified length, using random characters from the supplied character set.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GenerateRandomStringMasker

        public GenerateRandomStringMasker()
        Creates a masker generating strings with the same length as the input, using only alphabetic characters.

      • GenerateRandomStringMasker

        public GenerateRandomStringMasker(boolean letters,
                          boolean numbers)
        Creates a masker generating strings with the same length as the input data, using alphabetic and numeric characters, depending on the parameters. If both parameters are false, the masker samples from the whole range of possible characters.
        Parameters:
        letters - If true, generated strings contain alphabetic characters.
        numbers - If true, generated strings contain numeric characters.

      • GenerateRandomStringMasker

        public GenerateRandomStringMasker(char[] charSet)
        Creates a masker generating strings with the same length as the input, using random characters from the supplied character set.
        Parameters:
        charSet - The array from which characters are sampled. If null, all alphabetic characters are used.

      • GenerateRandomStringMasker

        public GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length)
        Creates a masker generating alphabetic strings with the specified length.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the strings to be generated. If negative, the length of the masked string is used.

      • GenerateRandomStringMasker

        public GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length,
                          boolean letters,
                          boolean numbers)
        Creates a masker generating strings with the specified length, using alphabetic and numeric characters, depending on the parameters. If both parameters are false, the masker samples from the whole range of possible characters.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the strings to be generated. If negative, the length of the masked string is used.
        letters - If true, generated strings contain alphabetic characters.
        numbers - If true, generated strings contain numeric characters.

      • GenerateRandomStringMasker

        public GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length,
                          char[] charSet)
        Creates a masker generating strings with the specified length, using random characters from the supplied character set.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the strings to be generated. If negative, the length of the masked string is used.
        charSet - The array from which characters are sampled. If null, all alphabetic characters are used.

      • GenerateRandomStringMasker

        public GenerateRandomStringMasker(int length,
                          boolean letters,
                          boolean numbers,
                          char[] charSet)
        Creates a masker generating strings with the specified length, using random characters from the supplied character set. The characters used can be alphabetic, numeric, or both, depending on the parameters. If these parameters are both set to false, the masker samples from the whole range of possible characters.
        Parameters:
        length - The length of the strings to be generated. If negative, the length of the masked string is used.
        letters - If true, generated strings contain alphabetic characters.
        numbers - If true, generated strings contain numeric characters.
        charSet - The array from which characters are sampled. If null, all alphabetic characters are used.

    • Method Detail

      • mask

        public java.lang.String mask(java.lang.String input)
        Generates a new random string according to the rules specified in the constructor.
        Parameters:
        input - The data instance to be masked.
        Returns:
        The masked data.
